questions.question_text:
You create a file system and then add a 2 GB file. You then take a snapshot of the file system.
What would be the total meteredBytes shown by the File Storage service after the hourly update cycle is complete?

discussion.content: A because snapshot does not use storage

choices.D: By default, the primary VNIC of an instance in a subnet has one primary private IP address.
choices.A: By default, the primary VNIC of an instance in a subnet has one primary private IP address and one secondary private IP address.
choices.B: Each VNIC can only have one private IP address.
choices.C: A private IP can have an optional public IP assigned to it if it resides in a public subnet.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
options D and C are the correct statements.

questions.question_text: Which TWO statements are TRUE about Private IP addresses in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: In the console,under the core infrastructure service, go to Block storage and then click BlockVolume replicas.ensure you are the proper region that contains the block replica volume you intend to activate

B -there is a block volume replica option readily available in the console. However, when creating the block volume, you have the option to either turn on or off the replication. Therefore, enabling/activating replication is required for it to replicate
https://blogs.oracle.com/cloud-infrastructure/post/cross-region-block-storage-volume-replication

Selected Answer: B
B. You need to click Activate, so Activate is a keyword here.

Selected Answer: C
No action required. By default, the replica is available as a block volume.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct, since activating the replica will initiate a clone to create the new volume.

questions.question_text:
You have a block volume created in the US West (Phoenix) region. You enabled Cross Region Replication for the volume and selected US West (San Jose) as the destination region. Now, you would like to create a new volume from the volume replica in the US West (San Jose) region.
What should you do?

choices.C: No action required. By default, the replica is available as a block volume.

questions.question_text: Which THREE capabilities are available with the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) DNS service? (Choose three.)

choices.A: Creating and managing Web Application Firewall (WAF) rules
choices.B: Creating and managing Identity Access Management (IAM) polices

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDF
C. Viewing all zones: The OCI DNS service allows you to view all the existing zones within your tenancy. This capability enables you to have visibility and control over the DNS configurations in your environment.

D. Creating and managing records: With OCI DNS, you can create and manage DNS records, such as A records, CNAME records, TXT records, etc. This capability allows you to define the mapping between domain names and IP addresses or other resources.

F. Creating and managing zones: OCI DNS enables you to create and manage DNS zones. A DNS zone is a container for DNS records associated with a specific domain. This capability allows you to define and control the configuration of DNS for your domains within OCI.

questions.question_text: Which statement is TRUE about delegating an existing domain to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) DNS service?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
By updating the nameserver configuration in the domain registrar's self-service portal, you effectively delegate the management of DNS records for that domain to OCI DNS. This allows OCI DNS to handle DNS queries and resolve DNS requests for your domain.

choices.D: Domains can be self-delegated to OCI DNS from its own service portal.
choices.E: Domains can be delegated to OCI DNS from the Domain Registrar's self-service portal.
choices.A: Domains can be delegated to OCI DNS via FastConnect partners.
choices.B: All domains can be retrieved to OCI DNS via DYN.
choices.C: Domains can be delegated to OCI DNS from the OCI Marketplace.
